availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William W. Buckley (Henry County, Kentucky, constable and deputy sheriff.)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, constable and deputy sheriff. Kentucky native. Son of Lucinda Buckley. Father of Posey Buckley, George T. Buckley, William M. Buckley. Deputy sheriff in Henry County, Kentucky, in 1849. Constable in Henry County in 1850. Resident of Henry County in 1860. Household owned sixteen enslaved persons in Henry County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry District 1, p. 368A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, New Castle, p. 246.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, New Castle, p. 198A.
Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky: Passed at December Session, 1844 (Frankfort, KY: A. G. Hodges, 1845), 201-2.
Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky: Passed at December Session, 1848 (Frankfort, KY: A. G. Hodges, 1849), 238.
